e4: Adopting the new policy ensures ethical responsibility and transparency in financial reporting, reducing risks of legal issues and enhancing the company’s long-term integrity. Even if some investors initially misunderstand the change, clear communication can mitigate confusion, ultimately strengthening trust with both retail and institutional investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and completeness, ensuring financial statements reflect the true state of the business. It should facilitate informed decision-making for all stakeholders and adhere to legal standards. Furthermore, it must address potential inequalities in information dissemination, preventing any group of investors from unfairly benefiting over others.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to effectively communicate the policy change to all investors to minimize market misunderstanding and how they will support retail investors during the transition to ensure fair access to accurate financial information.
